cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the Yucatán tonight, then moving northwest over the south-central Gulf on Thursday before turning north toward the north-west Gulf Coast (Texas-Louisiana border)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-western Louisiana to the TX/LA border (near Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect along the U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory 9A
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along the U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory 9A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft expected near Sabine Pass/Beaumont if track shifts west)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–55 mph) with higher gusts possible Friday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks closer to the TX/LA border.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in low-lying coastal areas and waterways connected to Sabine Lake.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday into Saturday with 4–8 inches, producing flash-flood potential in the Beaumont/Port Arthur area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands Friday; rough seas and very high waves on approaches to Sabine/Neches channels ahead of landfall.
